description:
Quick Backgammon is two games in one box. The first game is QuickGammon, a scaled down variant of backgammon that has fewer pieces and fewer points on the board, and uses d4 dice. Quickgammon is an introductory game to teach children and beginners the principles of backgammon.

Also included in the box is a standard backgammon board, and the game includes d6 dice and enough pieces to play the standard game.

[User summary from game box and rules.]

Gang Up! is casual card game where you compete to become the ultimate crime lord! Recruit legendary gang members and commit crazy daring crimes. Use criminal influences and team up with other players to get ahead. And when they least expect it, backstab them to win the game!

What's so good about Gang Up!?

Well...!


    Constantly choose between helping or backstabbing friends!
    Use weird card combos and advanced tactics
    Always influence the game, even when it's not your turn!
    Never get stuck at last place; we put you back in the race!
    An overload of crazy criminals & crimes!
    Beautiful artwork, no shabby back alley illustrations here.
    And it's easy to learn & quick to play!


Version 1: Kickstarter edition (english, 2015)
verion  2; published by HOT Games (english, 2016) & Czacha Games (polish, 2017)

A Fantasy Team Brawler Board Game. Play as one of seven unique characters in this exciting, easy to learn game of fantasy combat.

Guided by modern game design principles:

    No Player Elimination
    Simultaneous Turns
    One Hour Play Time
    Easy to Learn and Teach
    Deep Strategies


Game Play Highlights:


    Play on teams and use teamwork and strategy in head to head combat.
    Draft characters or deal them randomly.
    Build your character by choosing your abilities before the game starts.
    Play one ability per turn, simultaneously. You have access to all of your abilities every turn.
    Gain and spend "focus" using your ability cards.
    Reveal rune cards for bonus effects on the ability you play.
    Play a "level up" ability to add a wild card to your rune deck, giving you better odds on bonus effects for the rest of the game.
    Move and attack using your ability cards.
    Make meaningful choices about how to spend focus such as:
        Tactical Movement
        Fast, high damage attacks
        Level up for a late game strategy

In the world of Lyzarbhy the magic, chaos and the adventure welcomes you !

Fields of Gore is the introductory set for FOG game system edition. It is a basic set game containing forces of Orcs and Undead with a small rulebook, scenario book, paper templates, paper models, paper miniatures necessary to play. Set during The Great Orcoid Wars in the world of Lyzarbhi.

This PNP set contains two starter armies plus a scenario, player aids and redux rules of FOG system.

Players take command of each force, fighting a sample scenario and the rulebook have rules for create another ones, with a simplified points system.

With a rich lore and a lot of fluff, the game give to the players lot of fun without tons of rules.

Walk to Jesus is the first Christian Motivation Family Game in the world. It joins fun, religious education, it can be used for prayer or meditation base and besides all that it is a great game. It is a great way to spend some quality time together with your family.

To win in Walk to Jesus you need Divine Grace cards, which can be obtained by helping other players. Not only does this uphold one of basic Christian teachings, and has general moral value, it also adds to the depth of the game as Walk to Jesus is world’s first game requiring help to other players – your competitors – in order to win. This gives game a special strategic element making it more challenging and fun to play.

English description:

"As almirantes - Portuguese for admirals - in command of both a merchant and a war navy, 2 to 6 players build and navigate their fleets in order to dominate the geostrategic center of the ocean. In this exciting strategy game, however, one must call for divine help as conquering the ocean is nothing compared to holding it…"

Each almirante has the goal of dominating the ocean, that is, conquering and holding the field in the center of both ocean and board. For that, he or she builds and sails a fleet of both fishing boats and war galleons, by cleverly using the resources received in the beginning of each play: winds and coins. In addition, each almirante has three opportunities to use a god card.

Each play starts by receiving 6 winds and a variable amount of coins. Winds allow you to move your vessels: you need 1 wind to sail a fishing boat to another field, and 2 winds to do the same with a heavier galleon. Coins allow you to build new vessels: fishing boats cost you 2 coins, while galleons cost you 8 coins. You can trade these two resources, if you are willing to pay a conversion fee.

You then move your vessels. Sail your fishing boats to the shoal fields to fish and earn coins on your next turns (2 coins per each of the 6 shoals players compete for). Sail your galleons to meet opponent vessels in order to fight battles, or go for the center to conquer it. Battles are always won by the almirante with the most galleons on that field. Some defeated vessels are sunk and some of them may flee.

If the time is right, call upon the gods! Each almirante chose 3 god cards from equal pools of 8 before the game started, kept them secret and can now play each of them once - but only once. Play Aeolus and he will grant you extra winds, or maybe play Ares and he will sink an opponent's vessel...

Your play is now over. Are your galleons dominating the center of the ocean? Good, then slide one point along the scoreboard. Do this 4 times (in a game with 3-5 players) to win. But look out, the other almirantes are now sourrunding you and will want to join efforts to stop your countdown toward victory. Will they get you?


Portuguese Description:

Enquanto almirantes, no comando tanto de uma marinha mercante como de uma de guerra, 2 a 6 jogadores constroem e dirigem as suas frotas para dominar o centro geoestratégico do oceano. Neste entusiasmante jogo de estratégia, porém, têm de apelar a uma ajuda divina já que conquistar o oceano não é nada comparado a mantê-lo...

Objective: Be the first reaching space 60
 - moving by turns -
Typical 'Roll & Move' game

Roll the 2 dice by turns and step forward - until you end on a red marked space follow instructions (lid inside)
Notes:
Likely published 1910/20s
cute pewter pawns

Flat Cube is a solo card game consisting of six cards with a picture of half a coloured cube on each side, which will form a whole cube when placed next to the correct side of another card.

The player shuffles the cards then places them face up in a row. The aim of the game is to make all the cards line up with matching cubes (except for the two on either end, which will only match on one side).

In order to do this, the player must pull two (and only two) side-by-side cards out from the row and move them to an available slot — either on one end or in a space created by moving two previous cards. Continue doing this until the objective is complete, leaving no spaces and moving only two cards at any one time.

Bestialwars is a table-top fantasy miniature war game in heroic scale of 10mm {12mm real}, set in the lands of Zaneoss, continent of the flat world of Dabbath.

Bestial Wars is a stubborn game, carrying on the great tradition of the 80’s and 90’s, all miniatures are hand sculpted and casted using lead free metal.

...we just can’t help but love things that weigh !!!

Bestial Wars uses a 12mm scale for all its models, from troops to creatures. Thanks to the small size of the models, Bestial Wars battles are going to feel and look epic; furthermore, the limited number of bases in which miniatures are arranged will allow for fast and smooth deployment and movement. 
This structure makes the grand battles of Bestial Wars playable with the ease of a skirmish game!

Duel of Legends is a combat card game where the players take on the roles of Legends of different class types. They use Weapon and Defense items, along with Spell cards to try and defeat their opponents and be the last legend standing.

Average play time per Duel is 5-10 mins (2 players). Turns are fast but every choice has game changing effects. Easy Learning Curve: Most players feel comfortable with the game after 1 or 2 Duels. The game mechanics are simple, it’s the choices you make that separate the beginners from the veterans.

Over 1200 Class:Equipment Combinations, over 1.3 million starting Combinations. (with spells) Up to 4 players: Adding more players changes the dynamic of the game dramatically. Deciding who to attack and when is a key factor. In the end there can be only one, so allies don’t stay allies long.

4X Space boardgame revolving around assymetrical factions vying for control of the galaxy.

Each player plays a Faction and is set to a home system.

In this system, he needs to expand his fleet and colonies, so more resources are added to his growing empire.

At his side, each player has a powerful starship called Flagship. This ship research new modules, tactics and technologies.

But beware, other players are doing the same!

Struggle to survive against several threats like Pirates, Transdimensional invaders and opposite factions.

In the end, only one can achieve victory!

Your Uncle Floyd has given you and a few of your buds land to grow some recreational crops.

Inspired by the Facebook cult underground hit, Pot Farm: The Board Game is a 2-4 player competitive farming game where farmers plant high risk/high reward plants while protecting themselves from the Ranger deck. Higher payout crops need higher protection or else the Ranger might come to seize them! Using successfully harvested weed, farmers can buy unique items from a rotating Store to enhance their farms in strategic ways. The game ends when the seed bag is empty. The highest valued farm becomes the ultimate Pot Farm!

Players draw from the included Hemp bag and place crop tokens on their farm placards. Just planting on your farm doesn't guarantee the crops safety from Ranger Dick and competing farmers! Successfully harvesting plant tokens to your stash allows players to afford wacky contraptions and buildings from the rotating store deck to place on their farms for awesome combos and boosts to their production.

SpeakEasy is a game where players complete social missions. Most missions involve meeting people and making new friends. Others involve competing against your friends in outrageous challenges! Missions are printed on reusable coasters, which fit right in at your local bar, cocktail party, or picnic!

SpeakEasy is so simple to play, even an inebriate could learn! Here are the rules:

1. Draw a coaster. Read the mission out loud to the group.
2. Assign the mission to another player. 
3. That player has 3 minutes to complete the mission.
4. If they succeed, they win the coaster. If they fail (or refuse!), you win it. 
5. The first player to collect 5 coasters wins!

SpeakEasy has over 25 missions. Each one is designed to stretch your social circle, and introduce you to new people! Here are some samples:

In Come About players are maritime merchant traders in command of a fleet of trading ships navigating along many perilous trade routes. The player with the most ships along the most  number of trade routes is declared “Nauclerokubernetes”, the Greek word for merchant-master.

Materials
64 double sided tiles, two sets of 32 tiles in two colors Red and Green.
A way of keeping score.

Play
Come About is played on a board-less playing surface.

Two players Red and Green have each two sets of 16 double sided tiles in their chosen color.

Red starts by placing a tile either side up onto the table.
 Players then take turns placing a tile alongside another existing tile, connecting trade routes ( the dotted lines) across tile edges.

The game ends when all the tiles have been played.

A trade route is a continuous dotted line or loop containing 3 or more ships in either players color.

The player having the majority of ships in his color on a trade route scores 1 point for each of his ships. If a trade route has an equal number of ships in both colors, then neither player scores along that trade route.

The player with the highest score wins.

Bill Shakespeare is Dead is a highbrow/lowbrow party game for at least 5 players. There are variants for 3 and 4 players.

Transport yourself back to 17th century England. Ah, the good old days. The smell of feces and dead hobos in the street. The sight of unwashed masses and the complete lack of hygiene. Isn’t it lovely? You and your fellow players are members of the King’s Men, and you make your living saying pretty words to hundreds of filthy people. Better than digging ditches, right? Well tonight is supposed to be the opening night of a brand new play. The crowds are already gathered in the Globe Theatre, and the only thing missing is your star playwright, Bill Shakespeare. As it turns out, Bill had a little too much pickled herring and a lot too much wine and is as dead as disco. Now, armed with nothing but patches of the new script and (sometimes obscene) scribbles in the margins, you all need to put on a show. Good luck!

In Bill Shakespeare is Dead, one of Shakespeare’s famous plays is split into five short acts. During each act, one person acts as the Stage Manager, and two people are randomly chosen to act out the scene. As they go through the script, the rest of the players will have to fill in missing nouns and verbs randomly drawn from the deck and helpfully shouted when there is a blank part in the script. The Stage Manager chooses which nouns and verbs go where. At the end, you can tally your points and declare a winner, if that’s your sort of thing.

Collectible card game depicting players' lives!  Build your deck around your life's greatest accomplishments, your goals, dreams and failures.  Be the most successful as you tell your life's story in duel and multi-player formats!  The game "ends" when one players life (deck) runs out!  Count up your accomplishments and the winner is the one who's lived the "best" life.  Variable scoring options entice ccg hobbists to build different deck types and play themselves...or as the person they'd like to be!

Roots is a game of inventing words. Players combine Prefix and Suffix cards to create new words, competing for the best connection to a Subject card. Whoever delivers the best explanation for their word captures that Subject card, gaining a potential piece of their secret Win condition. But stay sharp: players can manipulate each other's progress with various Power cards, undermining opponents while advancing themselves. The result is narrative warfare in which the most creative, best spoken, and craftiest thrive.

Colour Wheel is a simple to learn, easy to play card game that teaches ROYGBIV color theory. The object is to be the first to have no cards left in your hand. Players lay down cards to make an ever-expanding wheel, creating a unique work of art every time it's played.

To better combat the rising tide of terrorism and threats around the globe, a new commission has formed. Comprised of elite teams from several intelligence agencies of the United States, SECTOR is mandated with the front-line defense of freedom and liberty.

But someone has to lead this organization, and you plan on being the one chosen as Administrator. So be prepared to defend against espionage and sabotage… and to commit acts of both to come out on top!

Over 12 rounds (weeks), each player will choose to place their three agents to perform one of the following options:

Perform an Action
Work a Mission
Get Help from The Agency
Play a Resource
Appropriate Resources

Managing resources wisely and completing missions will gain you Merit Points.  Direct, make shady deals and even sabotage other agencies to become the best!  The best managed agency at the end of the 12th week/round is the person who has earned the most merit points.

Objective: be the first arriving at target space 50
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game;
translation of the title "Barracks life".

remarks: the theme seems not to be a perfect platform for a 'Children's game', but the educational touch of the rules well.

Mit Zippo durch Herten is an educational game for children and families that has players move through and discover the city of Herten, North Rhine-Westphalia.

The game board is a map of the city. Traffic lights can hinder movement and players need to reach colored spaces that are placed in key locations and places of interest within the city.
It is also possible for players to anwser "Herten allgemein" (Herten in general) cards or play event cards to gain benefits or hinder other players.

Each player has a secret goal, which has him or her gather a number cards of different colors. Each color corresponds to different institutions, from recreational facilities to public services. A player gains a card when he enters a space of the same color on the board and then correctly answers the question given on it.

In doing so, the players get to know the layout of the city and learn about locations, services and activities.

Have you ever wanted to build from scratch, fine tune and then live your most erotic, intimate and romantic desires?

Ardor is an unique strategy sex card game that enables you to do it.

Compete to collect cards which will be the building blocks for your fantasy.

Win the first part of the game to decide which fantasy will come true.

Mix and match the collected cards for an experience filled with Ardor!

Enhance the cards for activities to take a naughty twist which you control at all times. You have complete freedom on enhancing the cards and you can even level up each card differently every time you play the game for a highly customizable experience.

There are thousands of possible combinations allowing you to craft unique and unforgettable experiences!

Ardor has two parts:
Win Your Fantasy is a card game in which you win points and cards.
Live Your Fantasy Create your fantasy using what you've won to control all the details of what will happen next.

What began as a celebration ended in tragedy when a wizard's fiery display went awry. Now, through no fault of your own, you find yourself trapped in a time loop forced to live the same day over and over and over and over again. Your only hope lies in a wizard whose advertisement you stumbled across in your search for answers and knowledge. He has informed you that he can cast a spell, tailor made for just you, that can open a portal through space and time.

For the first time in a very long while there is a faint glimmer of hope on the horizon. All you have to do is figure out a way to locate the spell components that the wizard needs and manage your day efficiently so that you can gather them all in time...

Evermore is a card auction, set collection, dice rolling game in which 2 - 4 players will compete to gain the knowledge necessary to efficiently gather the required components to win the game.

The players are pilgrims that get lost in an old enchanted forest. In order to find the exit they have to collect the magical items watched by Meiga, Moura and Lobishome in their dwellings, but...be careful! one of the players is the Santa Compaña, who disguised like a pilgrim try to undermine its playmates' pursuit and turn them one by one in its allies.

Every player has a Character card that shows if it is a Pilgrim or the Santa Compaña. He can't show it to the other players. Each player will use Pathway cards to move around the board choosing every turn what card have to play (they can be steps, bridge or do not move). Every Pilgrim has to look for two item cards shown in his Character card. The item cards are kept in the creature dwellings. In order to gain these cards the Pilgrim has to pay life tokens to the keepers. 
In the meantime the Santa Compaña player, secretly, will use its cards to threaten the other players, steal their life tokens and finally convert them to its allies. The only way for the Pilgrims to save themselves is to discover who is the Santa Compaña, use defensive item cards to repel it or finally find the requested cards to open the magical door and escape, reaching Santiago de Compostela.

Peregrinus is a dynamic and amusing game where luck, teamwork, intuition and strategy are equally necessary in order to discover dangers, find out the correct magical items, leave the enchanted forest before being caught by the Santa Compaña and reach Santiago. So, dare to enter the forest?

An all-dice game where players build towers and hire waves of monsters to send against their opponents.

Towers and monsters are both represented by dice.  In the first phase of each round, players spend resources to construct towers, cast spells and hire a variety of monsters.  In the second phase, players send hired monsters against their opponents.  A wave of monster dice is rolled, and the values on the dice are compared to the strength of the tower being attacked.  Each monster has a chance to activate special abilities to assist in the attack.

Each monster who passes all opposing towers has a chance to score victory points.

This is a card game where players are College Students trying to graduate before the Greedy Billionaire can take away all their money.  They start with a supply of money and will need to pay tuition and other expenses each year (round).  They score points for graduating and for avoiding bankruptcy.  The Greedy Billionaire is not an actual player but he scores points for each College Student that goes bankrupt.

Players graduate by playing 4 Pass Exam cards (one each for freshman, sophomore, junior and senior year) and one Graduation card.  In order to obtain enough money to pay tuition, players may play action cards to get a job, earn a scholarship and receive financial aid.  But beware!  Their opponents will play Greedy Billionaire Cards to send their job overseas, raise tuition, cut the education budget, pollute the earth, and accuse them of cheating.

Points are tallied at the end of each hand and the final object is to be the first player to score 150 points in several hands of play.

Switch is the exciting game in which three to five players race to play cards in sequence. But watch out! Letters and numbers can go up, down, or stay the same... and switch at any time. Be the first player out of cards and win!

Switch (the predecessor to Qwitch) consists of a deck of 64 cards, each containing one of eight numbers (1–8) and one of eight letters (A–H), and a die with plus, minus, and equals symbols. After hands are dealt, one player turns a card from the deck face up and rolls the die. Players race to play the next card from their hands, determined by the symbol on the die.

The game is played with two sets of cards, one set showing the top half of a ballerina figure in various positions, and the other showing the bottom half. The first player turns over one card of each type forming a complete picture of a ballerina and must imitate the position shown. On subsequent turns, each player must imitate the previous position from memory and then reveal a new one. The players win if they successfully complete the "ballet".

Dinos have been spotted in the jungle! You make hasty tracks after them to experience this excitement with your own eyes. But it‘s not very easy to catch sight of these massive ancient creatures. Whoever manages to uncover the sought after dinos and reach the end of the dinosaur footprint path first wins the game.

Each player takes a wooden dinosaur token and places it at the start of a four-tile track. Five dinosaur tiles are shuffled and placed face down in a row on the table. Then in turn, players turn over one of 26 search tiles. If the search tile shows a "trade symbol," the player exchanges two dinosaur tiles without looking at them. If the search tile shows a picture of two or three dinosaurs, the player must turn over an equivalent number of dinosaur tiles. If they match exactly, that player's dinosaur advances on the track. The first player to reach the end of the track wins.

In the "expert" variant, a sixth, blank tile is shuffled in along with the five dinosaur tiles.

Twelve chair tiles and twelve guest tiles are placed face-down on the table. On her turn, a player selects one chair tile and one guest tile. If they match, the player scores one point. Otherwise they are returned face-down to the table. When all of the guests are seated, the player who scored the most points wins.

Players take turns revealing tiles showing numbers and mathematical operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) and score points for correctly solving the revealed equations. The first player to score four points wins.
A limited best-of-edition celebrating Game: Black Stories' 10 year anniversary with 100 cards (twice the size of a normal edition) taken from Black Stories 1 through 10.

In order to charm the treasures away from the mighty genie the players have to find the correct path through the mysterious cavern. However, the treasure map has been torn into many pieces. Whoever has a quick eye for combinations and can piece together the map won’t lose his way and will find the most treasure. An intriguing lickety-split, brainteaser game for 2-4 players ages 6-99.

Players take turns rolling the die. If a 3,4, or 5 is rolled, that player draws that many path cards to their hand. If a genie is rolled, the top card of the assignment deck is turned over so everyone can see it. Each player draws the number of cards on the assignment card and adds it to their hand.

When all players are ready, they all turn over their path cards. Players are trying to arrange their path cards so that all paths connect, while trying to make the arrangement of their path cards match the pattern on the assignment card. The first player who does this correctly wins the round and takes a treasure card. The game ends after four rounds, and the player with the most treasure wins.

Adventurers seek to slay a nine headed hydra that has unleashed a myriad of monsters into the world.

This game contains tiles, chits, cards and dice.

Players win the game by either defeating the lead nine headed hydra and/or the head vampiress. The game is lost when all tiles are placed unless using the optional rule for infinite enemies.

To defeat all of the monsters, the players can gather weapons from the item deck by buying them at a shop or by using spells from the spell deck. Some items can also be found when defeating enemies.

Join tiles edge to edge to expand your territory and finally turn your areas into victory points
Watch out though, making your areas too big detracts from your score and can even lead to losing points
Can you keep your areas at just the right size to get the highest score?
It's a territory control game with concise rules and interesting dilemmas

You are playing the roles of millionaires who collect mysterious artefacts from the four corners of the earth. Apparently, when collected in threes, these objects have amazing powers. Auctions bore you, so instead you and your rivals have to agree on how to divvy up each load of artefacts. In each round, three objects must be divided up between two players. Each person takes what he or she wishes – if the other person agrees! Is it a deal?

In each round (or Deal), place 3 artefact cards in the middle of the table: 2 face up and 1 face down. Two players must agree on how to divide up these 3 cards. Attention: all the cards must go somewhere; none can be set aside. Cards from previous rounds cannot be exchanged. Negotiations are free and open. They end as soon as both players accept a proposal and say, “DEAL!”
Once an agreement has been reached, the 2 players each take their share and place it behind their own screens. The player who has obtained the face-down card can look at it (secretly or openly) and put it with his or her other cards.
The game ends with there are no more cards in the stack.

The Supershow  is a wrestling tabletop dice and card game for 2 - 6 players. Supershow is the worlds first UCG, or Unpredictable Card Game, that takes place in the underground wrestling world of the Legendary Fighting Federation. The goal of the game is to hit your finish card for a chance to defeat your opponent.

The Supershow gives players the back and forth excitement of a live wrestling match using its unique turn structure. Players attempt to build up to their Finish cards by using Lead and Follow-up cards. Once you hit one of your three devastating Finish cards, you will attempt to keep your opponent down for the three-count. If your breaks out of your finish, the crowd's excitement goes up, and the next finish is more likely to end the high-energy match. The simplicity of the rules allows games to last just 5 - 10 minutes, while still being highly competitive and too exciting to just have one match.

The Supershow also has mechanics for multiplayer formats: three-way, four-way, 2-4 player tag team, and tornado tag team. Each format can be elimination style or first to Finish. This is on top of different match types (stipulations) that are played with no additional purchases, such as escape the cage or submission match.

With over 90+ players at the Supershow World Championship at GenCon 2017, the Supershow is more than a game you play with some friends; it's a community of players competing year-round to have the bragging rights of World Champion. The founders of SRG Universe are life-long gaming and wrestling fans and treat the Supershow as a wrestling promotion.

It will take strengthyness, craftyness and magickyness to be Gameshop Adventurers.

This is a D&D style adventure game for 1 or 2 players.

Needed to play: the deck of 6 cards, 1d20 and 4 eurocubes.

The players work together as a Party of Adventurers to survive their journey and defeat what awaits them in the final room. Each player chooses one Player Card and then which side they wish to use, placing cubes to mark their initial XP and HP.

Each player begins with 2 skills, listed next to their initial XP: STR (Strengthyness) and CRF (Craftyness). All players have a starting STR equal to a D4 and a CRF which will differ depending on which card they chose.

For both STR and CRF, the die rolls will be as stated until you reach a new XP level where they will increase (ex. The Warrior begins with a STR:D4, when he reaches 2 XP this then changes to STR:D5)

The Sorceress and Wizard can also cast magic spells (their Magickyness). There are two types of spells: those in blue can be cast at any time during an Attack; those in red can be cast during an Attack but the player may not use their STR to help (see Attack below) in the Party Attack number. Only one spell may be cast in an Attack.

Each player also begins the game with a Special Skill or Starting Spell which is listed at the bottom of the Player Card.

Attack: Most rooms have a foe in them to be overcome. Attacking is mandatory unless the Wizard uses his Enchantment Spell (in this case the party moves to the next room and there is no attack but the party receives +1XP for being sneaky).

Each player will roll for their STR value separately and both values are then added together. This is the Party Attack number. One player then rolls for the STR of the foe (as listed in the current room). This is the Foe Attack number. If the Party Attack number is equal to or higher than the Foe Attack number, the players win the attack, slay the foe and proceed to the next room, with each player gaining the Success Bonus as listed. If the Party Attack value is lower, each player takes the amount of HP damage as listed and they then proceed to the next room.

Order of Play: The players will proceed from room to room, in numerical order, until they reach the final room where they will be successful and live to fight another day, thereby winning the game, or they will be soundly and  utterly defeated.

This is the 4th in a series of Annual Games Unlimited Holiday Games and is the followup to Gameshop Express (2011), Gameshop Workday (2012) and Gameshop Gladiators (2013)

From the publisher:

Welcome Battle Commanders! The future of your faction's survival is depending on you! Gain influence and expand your forces to strategically defeat the opposing faction. You win the battle when you reduce your opponent’s health to zero. However, a Battle Commander must be cautious if their opponent is off-initiative. Since Battle for Sularia is a round-based card game, if your opponent is off-initiative, they have the chance to strike back and reduce your health total below theirs and thereby defeating you and winning the game!

FEATURES/GAME PLAY INCLUDES:

Multiple Play Modes
With one box, you and your friend can play with the preconstructed 60 card play decks in a head-to-head 2 player game. The two players can then play in our "60/90" constructed format by customizing their play decks with the additional 60 cards provided in the box! If draft play is more your style, one box also supports 2-4 player draft play! An 8 player draft simply requires one additional box. Of course, the game is fully expandable for a variety of casual play modes – one box supports up to 2 players in casual mode, but there is simply no limit on how many players and formats are available with additional boxes.

Construction Point Values
Unique "60/90" deck construction system. Each card has a construction point value of 1 to 4 points. Each deck must have a minimum of 60 cards and a deck cannot exceed a total construction value of 90 points. This system pushes the envelope on deck construction and maintains value and interests for all cards within the set – not just a few select overpowered options.

Two-resource System
Engaging two-resource system which includes influence and sularium. Influence increases once per round, while each player uses their influence to establish sites on their turn to help build their sularium stockpiles. Sularium is used to deploy combatants, which are used to attack your opponent's sites. The two-resource system in turn provides additional strategies for repeatable game play.

Round-based Game
Simultaneous combat. The game runs on a round-based system, which allows each player to complete their turn before the round is over.

microulette is a single card nano game. Each round, players take turns pushing their luck to collect points by rolling the dice and placing bet tokens. The results of two of the three dice are added together. If the player has placed a token on the number that matches that value, the player scores points associated with that spot. Other spots on the card allow the players to mitigate their luck by modifying the outcome of the dice rolls.

oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble can be played standalone out of the box or it forms an addition to the oddball Aeronauts card game - a simple, light strategy, played-in-the-hand (no surface required) card game of hi-jinks airship dogfights, set in an oddball fantasy world. Players take their airship officers, crew and bots, and go head-to-head in a duel in the sky of an oddball, steampunk-esque world.

oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble adds 2 new factions to the game - the Mechinauts and the Free Kingdoms - as well as rules for 3 or 4 players.

Note - by downloading the rules to the original oddball Aeronauts game, you can play oddball Aeronauts 2 : Double the Trouble as a 2 player game right out of the box with no need to purchase the original game.

Overview from the publisher:

Monster extermination is a game for 2 to 3 players to discover who is the best Monster Hunter.
Each player use six different magic weapons to repeal 30 different monsters.
Who's the best hunter of them all ?
It's time to find out.
Let's get started

Straight out of the Firefly 'verse comes Firefly: Tall Card! With rules and artwork inspired by the game played on Firefly, Tall Card will make you feel like you're a fellow crew member aboard Serenity! Each box contains a 66-card deck, including the round "Tall Cards" as seen on Firefly! Also included are more than 50 additional cards so you can create other Tall Card variants.

The gameplay is similar to draw poker, but the suits are inspired by Mah Jong tiles so the composition of the deck is very different from a standard 52-card deck.

Your story - your rules!

Zombies wherever you look. Nobody knows Where they come from and what they want. Mindless, hungry and unstoppable, they hunt the living. Zombies! All that's left is to arm yourself to the teeth just to see another day. You are part of a group of survivors, trying to fight against overpowering Undead. All for one, or maybe sacrifice one for all? Where do the Zombies come from, and how can you get rid of them? Maybe they are part of a bigger plan? Make your own story and see for yourself what happens.

Zombia is a narrative card game in the Mini Story series by Noris Spiele. Cards determine their role, their relations to each other and their secret goals. A game last over five rounds, after which the winner(s) are identified as related to their goals.

Your story - your rules!

Area 51. Im Jahr 1956 wird die verlassene Basis plötzlich wiederbelebt. Zwischenfälle mit abgestürzten „Heißluftballons“, Gerüchte von Ufosichtungen und paranormale Phänomene häufen sich schlagartig in den folgenden Monaten in diesem Gebiet. Allerlei Spekulationen und wilde Gerüchte kursieren. Doch eigentlich ist eines allen irgendwie klar: Die Aliens sind gelandet. Nur wer sind sie, und wem kannst du trauen?

Area 51. In 1956 the abandoned base all of a sudden came back to life again. In the following months, more and more rumours arise of crashed hot-air balloons, ufo sightings and paranormal phenomenons. Speculations and wild reports circulate. But everyone agrees on one thing: The aliens have landed. But who are they, and whom can you trust? Make your own story and see for yourself what happens.

Ufo Attacks is a narrative card game in the Mini Story series by Noris Spiele. Cards determine their role, their relations to each other and their secret goals. A game last over five rounds, after which the winner(s) are identified as related to their goals.

Your story - your rules!

Rumours of the mysterious research station "OMEGA" make their rounds within scientific circles. Secret experiments during the war are said to have unearthed discoveries beyond the wildest dreams of any scientist. But all of a sudden all contact to the station broke off. Nobody knows what became of the researchers or the station. Now, 20 years after the end of the war, hints to "OMEGA" surface again, while you try to look into it. What is behind all this? What secrets may "OMEGA" hold? And who will get to use them? Make your own story and see for yourself what happens.

Die verlassene Forschungsstation (The abandonded Research Station) is a narrative card game in the Mini Story series by Noris Spiele. Cards determine their role, their relations to each other and their secret goals. A game last over five rounds, after which the winner(s) are identified as related to their goals.

This game includes 4 different playing options:

I. Turno-Race: The tiles form a race track (see box cover). Movement is determined by a die. If a player gets on a tile with an even number of dots, he turns the tile and advances as many tiles as dots show up. If a player rolls an odd number, he hast to go backward and may not turn the tile.

II. Turno-Lottery: The tiles form a 6-pointed star. The players place their meeple on a tile. If the die shows the number of their tile, they may remove the tile. The first player to remove all 6 tiles of his leg of the star, wins the game.

III. Turno-Domino: The 6-edged center tile is placed on the table. The players draw tiles and add one at a time to the center tile, till a six pointed star is formed. The first player to use up all his tiles wins the game.

IV. Turno-Boardgame: The 36 tiles combine to a game board of 6x6 tiles. The meeples start on a corner tile, have to cross the board to any tile on the other side and return to their starting tile, to win the game. Movement is determined by a die. If a player, for instance, rolls a 5 he can advance to a neighbouring tile, that shows 5 dots, or he can go to a tile showing 3 dots and further to a tile showing 2 dots.

The game of escape of the  famous painter Rikanati in Venice in 1756!

The aim of the game is to discover with your Lord, the famous painter Rikanati and secure him to your palace,before he was discovered by the Doge.

Preparing the Game
Each player chooses one of the colored palaces and a medallion of the same color.
Pawns / figures, mix well so that no players may not know what the playing figure is positioned Rikanati.
Each player chooses a pawn / figure and places it in the Gondolas.
Hangs the medallion has chosen in his figures to standout and placed in front of the palace.
The other figures that do not belong to a player, placed by all players, depending on their preference, in seven theaters.
In each theater is placed only a figure!
Now nobody knows where exactly hiding Rikanati!!!
There is chance to be already below the figure of any players.
The remaining permits gondolas placed by player to the dock preferences.On each pier is placed a gondola!

Now mix the jewelery cards.
A player gets up the card that is above the rest and thus determines which player will start first the game.
Then each player gets the card jewelry that corresponds to him.
When you play less than three players remaining cards are placed back in the box.

The motion in channels and alleys

If it's your turn to play, you can move all three gondolas.
Each time you move a gondola from a pier in a another should be keeping the following:

1) The three movements may preferably split them either in your own gondola with your pawn,either in empty gondolas.
 But you never move a gondola which standing pawn of other players.

2) On each pier is placed a gondola along.
Each pier has a column.The position of the column shows
(in case of doubt) in which channel belongs the pier.

3)No allowed the overtaking of the pier if there is another gondola stopped.Exceptions are the five palaces and palace of the Doge.

4)After moving the gondolas, in continuation of your turn you move your pawn.
You can download your pawns from the gondola,to cross an alley to reach the next pier and if there is free gondolas upload your pawns and continue wandering in Venice.

5)Every time your pawn arrives at an alley, you can cross it until the end.
With dexterous movements in alleys and moving appropriate the gondolas you can move very quickly your pawns.
When intersecting alleys, is not allowed to change course.

6)At the end of your turn should your pawn park again in a gondola.The game continues with the searching of Rikanati.

7) As your figure crosses with the gondola the board of the game
is looking the gondolas and theaters for Rikanati.
Looks rapidly under the cloak of the other figures which is  parked there.

Rikanati is on another gondola

1) To find Rikanati you must reach your figure to a pier,
 you cross the alley and you met a another figure which probably can be hidden Rikanati.You take the two figures (your own and that you meet) and examined them under the table.

2) If you discover under the cloak of the figure that you met 
or even your own figure, the Rikanati(namely...the white nail)
you can change the medallion secretly and this way bring the Rikanati in your own pawn.
Place the pawn back in gondolas are parked on the pier and return your  pawn in your own gondola after walking rear in the alley.

Rikanati located in theater

If you discover Rikanati in theater you can change again the medallion secretly and bring him to your gondola.

Bribery

Before you transport Rikanati in your palace with safety, you must bribe the Doge to withdraws his pursuers.
Therefore you must pass your figure from the  palace of the Doge and leave it at a jewelry card.

Winner

The player who manages to get to his palace with Rikanati, is the winner of the game. For confirmation shows the lower part of the figure to the other players.

Join the SimplyFun Buddies for a hoppin’ good time! Buddy Hop features two games in one! Game one concentrates on building your child’s memory and sequencing skills, while game two concentrates on building quick visual association skills. The durable, soft foam character mats are great for indoor and outdoor play.

There is no "taking turns" in Corner Center Match! All players race to match the corner on their cards to the shape and color on the card in the center of the table. Don't forget to check the back sides of your cards if you get stuck, but be quick!
